      • getInitialPosition

        public java.awt.Point getInitialPosition(WorldAgent agent)
        Description copied from class: World
        Retrieves an initial position for a WorldAgent of the World. This method must be implemented by subclasses to give a custom initial position and to register the agent if needed.
        Specified by:
        getInitialPosition in class World
        Parameters:
        agent - the agent calling the method as an WorldAgent
        Returns:
        an initial position as a Point

      • getVillagePosition

        public java.awt.Point getVillagePosition()
        Retrieves the position of the Village in the VillageWorld.
        Returns:
        the position of the village as a Point

      • checkNearby

        public java.awt.Point checkNearby(int type,
                                  java.awt.Point position,
                                  int range)
                           throws WorldException
        Allows to check if a WorldEntity of a certain type is situated in the range of a given position.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of entities to look for, which value has to be defined in VillageWorldTypes
        position - the position from which to look for entities as a Point
        range - the range in which to look for entities as an integer
        Returns:
        the position of the nearest entity of the defined type i the range of the given position as a Point, or null if no entity is found in the range
        Throws:
        WorldException - if the type given in parameter is not a type known in VillageWorldTypes

      • isWoodRemaining

        public boolean isWoodRemaining(java.awt.Point woodPosition)
        Allows to check if there is still some wood to cut at a certain position in the VillageWorld.
        Parameters:
        woodPosition - the position on which to check as a Point
        Returns:
        true if there is still some wood to cut at the specified position, false otherwise

      • cutWood

        public void cutWood(java.awt.Point woodPosition)
        Allows to cut some wood at a certain position in the VillageWorld.
        Parameters:
        woodPosition - the position on which to cut some wood as a Point
